text: - We've been with AWS since day one.

They're really trying to
understand what are your problems
and what are you trying to achieve.
- Legacy search is noisy.
It's all SEO.
It's all pay-per-click.
It's very cumbersome for the user.

You have to scroll down to
the second or third page
before you find the content
that is actually relevant to you,

and that first two or three
pages is heavily ad-based.

Perplexity is attacking
the search engine market.
It's an information retrieval tool.
It's an answer engine.

- Generative AI is at
the core of Perplexity.
We use this technology

not only to understand the
user's questions better,
but also synthesize answers for them.
It's actually grounded and trustworthy.

We allow you to get your
answers much quicker,

and that has use cases
both for the consumers
and the enterprise.
When we started Perplexity,

we were very limited
in computer resources,

and that's why we took advantage
of AWS Activate Program.

We were able to reciprocate
it to run our infrastructure,
and we were able to make some key hires
and innovate on the product.
That allows us to move much faster
and not worry about future fundraise.

We workED with AWS to launch
Perplexity Enterprise Pro.
It allows you to synthesize information

from all over internet,
from internal documents,
from proprietary data,
and it builds an environment

where people in the same
company can collaborate.
They can share the research

that they've been working
with with their teammates.
They can work on it together
and take advantage of our AI
to go about their business much faster
and make better decisions.
- In our organization,

the benefits we're saving
were instantaneous.

We're able to ask what is
relevant in this industry
that I should be focusing on,
and within a matter of seconds,

we have all that research
within our fingertips.
We know it's gonna be accurate.
We know that it's factual
because you have that cited sources.

The amount of productivity
that it's brought
and the efficiency to enable our workforce
to be more technical.

- What we're trying to do is
replace time with intelligence.

We've been working with
Amazon SageMaker HyperPod
to enable that.
That's the technology that we use to train
and serve our models.
Over time, we're gonna see that
once the intelligence increases,

the productivity is gonna
improve tremendously.
AWS is gonna be perfect the partner
to get to that future together

because it will require a
lot of computational power,
cutting-edge infrastructure,
and I'm very confident
that AWS will be able to deliver that.
(gentle upbeat music)
(gentle upbeat music fades)
